page.topic: Populate a Tree Control Using Javascript
page.description: You can popluate a tree in a UX component using javascript. This example uses javascript to populate a node on a tree control and then to repopulate the entire tree.

section.description: This guide is watchable through [this video].

section.title: Using Javascript to Populate a Node on a Tree

step.description: Open the UX Builder. Open the UX Controls page in the Design tab and look at the Data Controls menu. Add a Tree control to the component.
Highlight the tree control and view its control properties list. Scroll down the list to the Tree Properties section and find the Tree data type property, set this to the JSON option.
The Tree data (JSON) property should appear underneath "Tree data type". Click the [...] button next to the Tree data (JSON) property.
In the Tree Control - JSON Data dialog click the Insert sample JSON button in the lower left corner. Then click OK.
Run the tree control in the Live Preview tab to see what it looks like.
On the UX Controls page again go to the Other Controls menu, lower left, and add a Button control to the component. Give it the name "Populate node on tree" in the 'Button text' property.
Highlight the button. Scroll down the control properties list to the "Javascript (Touch, Mouse, Pointer Events)" section. Click the [...] button next to the click property.
